title: Any ideas on how and/or if they decide to add all 145+ champions into this thing?
body:
It seems as though the RNG and gold management would be utterly overwhelming.

And oh god, the toxic using champs...

replies.body:
They won't have all 140+ champs in TFT. 

They will have "sets" (which consists of 50 champs) of champions per rank split, after each split, they will switch out to different sets of champs. They can also have different skins of the same champ to represent different origins and classes.

That's how they can have a Pirate/Sorcerer for Cutpurse TF. If they used Musketeer or Highnoon TF instead, then you probably would get a Noble/Ranger.

Yeah so they'll likely do a massive overhaul each season taking out entire alliances and putting in new ones. I'm looking forward to it. The other option they could use(which I highly doubt they will use) is one where there are 4 different Pools that can be played from that is randomly decided and shown from the start.

maybe season to season they change the champs just to keep it from getting too boring. 
With the way the champ pool is, though, too many champs would make it too hard to get what you need for your comp.

They should probably send "decks" out in waves.

Like lets just say this itteration of TFT is deck 1.
and then another itteration would have a completely different set of cards.
They do, but they don't want them all in at once. I believe they said they were aiming for about 50 at a time, and they'd rotate them out every now and then.

I doubt that's the end game of this game mode.  They clearly want people to be able to adjust and think on their feet, and it would be near impossible to do that if they had that many possible synergies and options (not to mention the difficulty remembering what anything was).  

It would also be impossible to even get a single guy level 2, because there'd be ~1/30 chance to roll the same guy twice...
